title: Deuteronomy Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Deuteronomy chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Deuteronomy Chapter 22.

questions.question: What must you do if you see your brother's ox or sheep go astray?
options: Bring them again to your brother
Ignore it and walk away
Sell them to someone else
Keep them for yourself
questions.correctAnswer: Bring them again to your brother
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:1 commands that you must bring back your brother's ox or sheep if they go astray.

questions.question: If you do not know your brother or he is not near, what should you do with his lost animal?
options: Bring it to your own house until your brother seeks it
Leave it where it is
Sell it and keep the money
Kill it
questions.correctAnswer: Bring it to your own house until your brother seeks it
questions.explanation: According to Deuteronomy 22:2, if your brother is not near or you do not know him, you must bring the lost animal to your house and keep it until he seeks it.

questions.question: What garments are forbidden to be worn by a woman according to Deuteronomy 22?
options: That which pertaineth unto a man
Silk garments
Clothes of pure linen
Any colorful garments
questions.correctAnswer: That which pertaineth unto a man
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:5 states that a woman shall not wear that which pertaineth unto a man.

questions.question: What should you do if you find a bird's nest with the mother sitting upon the young or eggs?
options: Let the mother go and take the young
Take both the mother and the young
Destroy the nest
Ignore the nest
questions.correctAnswer: Let the mother go and take the young
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:6-7 instructs to let the mother bird go and only take the young so that it may be well with you and your days prolonged.

questions.question: What is one of the instructions given when building a new house?
options: Make a battlement for the roof
Use only wood from a holy tree
Paint the walls white
Build a tower
questions.correctAnswer: Make a battlement for the roof
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:8 commands that when building a new house, you must make a battlement for the roof to prevent someone from falling off.

questions.question: What is forbidden to be sown together in a vineyard?
options: Divers seeds
Wheat and barley
Corn and beans
Only grapes
questions.correctAnswer: Divers seeds
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:9 states you shall not sow your vineyard with divers seeds to avoid defiling the fruit.

questions.question: What kind of animals must not be plowed together?
options: An ox and an ass
Two oxen
Two asses
A horse and a mule
questions.correctAnswer: An ox and an ass
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:10 forbids plowing with an ox and an ass together.

questions.question: What kind of garment is forbidden because it is made of mixed materials?
options: Woollen and linen together
Cotton and silk together
Leather and linen together
Silk and woollen together
questions.correctAnswer: Woollen and linen together
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:11 prohibits wearing garments made of woollen and linen mixed together.

questions.question: What should be made on the four corners of your garment?
options: Fringes
Tassels
Buttons
Patches
questions.correctAnswer: Fringes
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:12 instructs to make fringes on the four corners of the garment you cover yourself with.

questions.question: What must the father and mother bring to the elders if a man accuses his wife of not being a virgin?
options: Tokens of the damsel's virginity
Her wedding clothes
A written contract
Witnesses
questions.correctAnswer: Tokens of the damsel's virginity
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:15-16 states that the parents must bring tokens of the damsel's virginity to the elders to prove her chastity.

questions.question: What happens to a man who lies with a married woman, according to this chapter?
options: He shall die along with the woman
He shall pay a fine
He shall be exiled
He shall be flogged
questions.correctAnswer: He shall die along with the woman
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:22 says both the man and the married woman shall die for adultery.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 22 forbids a man to take his father's wife or uncover his father's skirt.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:30 states that a man shall not take his father's wife or uncover his father's skirt.

questions.question: True or False: If a betrothed damsel is forced in the field, both the man and the damsel shall die.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:25-26 clarifies only the man shall die; the damsel is not punished.

questions.question: True or False: You must help your brother if his ox or ass falls down by the way.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:4 commands you to help your brother lift his fallen ox or ass.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Deuteronomy 22:29: 'Then the man that lay with her shall give unto the damsel's father ______ shekels of silver.'
options: fifty
one hundred
twenty
ten
questions.correctAnswer: fifty
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:29 states the man must give fifty shekels of silver to the damsel's father.

medium.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Deuteronomy Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer finds their neighbor's lost sheep wandering nearby. Based on Deuteronomy 22, how should they respond?
options: Ignore it and assume the owner will find it
Bring it back to the owner if known, or keep it safe until the owner claims it
Sell it and keep the money
Leave it where it is to avoid trouble
questions.correctAnswer: Bring it back to the owner if known, or keep it safe until the owner claims it
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:1-3 commands that one must not hide from a brother's lost ox or sheep but bring it back to him or keep it safe until he seeks it. This teaches the virtue of honesty and responsibility toward others' property.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 22:4 teach us about helping others in practical ways?
options: We should only help if we know the person well
We must help lift a brother’s fallen ox or donkey without hiding from the responsibility
Helping others is optional and based on convenience
We should call someone else to help instead
questions.correctAnswer: We must help lift a brother’s fallen ox or donkey without hiding from the responsibility
questions.explanation: Verse 4 instructs believers not to ignore a brother’s fallen animal but to assist in lifting it up, emphasizing compassion and practical service toward neighbors.

questions.question: What biblical principle about gender roles and appearance is taught in Deuteronomy 22:5?
options: Men and women should wear similar clothing for unity
Women should not wear men's clothing and men should not wear women's garments; it is an abomination to God
Clothing has no spiritual significance
Everyone should dress in the latest fashion
questions.correctAnswer: Women should not wear men's clothing and men should not wear women's garments; it is an abomination to God
questions.explanation: This verse teaches respect for God’s design in gender distinctions and calls for obedience in how we present ourselves before God and others.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to take both the mother bird and her young from a nest. What does Deuteronomy 22:6-7 teach about stewardship and trust in God?
options: It is acceptable to take both for personal gain
One should let the mother bird go and only take the young to prolong one’s days
Taking the mother bird is encouraged for protection
Ignore the nest entirely
questions.correctAnswer: One should let the mother bird go and only take the young to prolong one’s days
questions.explanation: These verses emphasize mercy and trust in God’s provision by sparing the mother bird, showing care for life and faithfulness in stewardship.

questions.question: When building a new house, what practical wisdom regarding safety and responsibility does Deuteronomy 22:8 provide?
options: Build as quickly as possible without extra precautions
Make a battlement on the roof to prevent accidents and avoid bringing blood upon your house
Ignore safety measures because God protects
Only build small houses to avoid falls
questions.correctAnswer: Make a battlement on the roof to prevent accidents and avoid bringing blood upon your house
questions.explanation: This teaches the importance of taking practical safety measures to protect others and prevent harm in our homes.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 22:9-10, what does God teach about integrity and order in agricultural and daily work?
options: It is acceptable to mix different seeds and plow with different animals
Do not sow your vineyard with diverse seeds or plow with an ox and an ass together
Only the quality of work matters, not method
Using multiple animals together is more efficient
questions.correctAnswer: Do not sow your vineyard with diverse seeds or plow with an ox and an ass together
questions.explanation: These commands promote purity and order in work, highlighting faithfulness and discipline in daily labor.

questions.question: What spiritual discipline is taught by Deuteronomy 22:11-12 regarding clothing and remembering God’s commandments?
options: Wear mixed fabrics to show wealth
Do not wear garments of mixed wool and linen, but make fringes on your garments as a reminder
Clothing has no relation to spiritual discipline
Avoid wearing fringes as they are outdated
questions.correctAnswer: Do not wear garments of mixed wool and linen, but make fringes on your garments as a reminder
questions.explanation: The fringes serve as a physical reminder to obey God’s commands, teaching mindfulness and devotion in daily life.

questions.question: A man accuses his wife of not being a virgin at marriage. According to Deuteronomy 22:13-19, what biblical principle about justice and protection in marriage is taught?
options: The man’s accusation is enough to condemn the wife
The parents must show the tokens of virginity before elders, and if false accusations are made, the man is punished and must keep the wife
The wife is immediately divorced
The elders ignore such accusations
questions.correctAnswer: The parents must show the tokens of virginity before elders, and if false accusations are made, the man is punished and must keep the wife
questions.explanation: This protects women from false accusations and teaches fairness and honor in marriage and community.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 22:20-21 instruct the community to deal with a woman found guilty of premarital unchastity?
options: She should be forgiven without consequence
She shall be stoned to death to remove evil from the community
She should be punished by a fine
The husband should divorce her quietly
questions.correctAnswer: She shall be stoned to death to remove evil from the community
questions.explanation: The law emphasizes the seriousness of purity and the community’s role in maintaining holiness by removing sin.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 22:22 teach about faithfulness in marriage and consequences for adultery?
options: Only the woman is punished
Both the man and the married woman who commit adultery shall die
Only the man is punished
Adultery is overlooked if done secretly
questions.correctAnswer: Both the man and the married woman who commit adultery shall die
questions.explanation: This passage shows the high value God places on marital faithfulness and the seriousness of breaking that covenant.

questions.question: A virgin betrothed to a husband is found lying with another man in the city. According to Deuteronomy 22:23-24, what should the community do?
options: Punish only the man
Stone both the man and the woman to death
Allow divorce without punishment
Ignore the offense if no witnesses
questions.correctAnswer: Stone both the man and the woman to death
questions.explanation: The passage teaches the community to uphold purity and justice by removing sin publicly.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 22:25-27, how does the law view a betrothed damsel who is forced and raped in the field?
options: She is guilty and punished
She is innocent and the man alone shall die
Both are punished equally
The matter is ignored
questions.correctAnswer: She is innocent and the man alone shall die
questions.explanation: The law protects the victim by recognizing her innocence and condemning the violent attacker.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 22:28-29 teach about responsibility and restitution when a man lies with a virgin who is not betrothed?
options: The man must pay fifty shekels and marry her, not putting her away
The woman must marry the man
The man is free to leave without consequences
No action is required
questions.correctAnswer: The man must pay fifty shekels and marry her, not putting her away
questions.explanation: This law teaches accountability, restitution, and protection of the woman’s dignity.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 22:30 forbids a man from marrying his father's wife or uncovering his father's wife’s skirt.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: This command establishes respect for family boundaries and honor, forbidding incestuous relationships.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 22 instructs believers to hide from their brother’s lost property to avoid responsibility.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 1-3 clearly command believers not to hide from their brother’s lost animals or property but to help restore them, teaching honesty and love.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Deuteronomy 22:12 commands believers to make fringes upon the four _______ of their garments as a reminder to obey God's commandments.
options: corners
colors
layers
buttons
questions.correctAnswer: corners
questions.explanation: The fringes on the four corners of garments serve as a physical reminder to keep God's laws, promoting spiritual discipline.

hard.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Deuteronomy Chapter 22.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 22:1-4, what responsibility does one have upon finding a lost ox or sheep belonging to a brother?
options: Bring it back to the owner or keep it until he seeks it
Sell the animal and give the money to the poor
Ignore it as it is not your property
Kill it and offer it as a sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: Bring it back to the owner or keep it until he seeks it
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:1-4 commands that if you see your brother's ox or sheep wandering, you must not ignore but bring it back to him or keep it until he asks for it.

questions.question: What is the cultural and theological significance of the command in Deuteronomy 22:5 forbidding a woman to wear a man's garment and vice versa?
options: It enforces gender distinctions as a reflection of created order and holiness
It is a prohibition against theatrical costume wearing
It forbids all forms of clothing trade between men and women
It promotes uniform clothing for all Israelites
questions.correctAnswer: It enforces gender distinctions as a reflection of created order and holiness
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:5 highlights the importance of maintaining clear gender distinctions as part of Israel's holiness code, reflecting the created order and God's design.

questions.question: In Deuteronomy 22:6-7, what is the rationale given for allowing the taking of young birds from a nest but commanding the release of the mother bird?
options: To prolong your days and that it may be well with you
To prevent the extinction of birds
To honor the mother bird as a sacred symbol
To avoid ritual impurity
questions.correctAnswer: To prolong your days and that it may be well with you
questions.explanation: The passage in Deuteronomy 22:6-7 commands releasing the mother bird to ensure well-being and longevity, illustrating a principle of mercy and stewardship over creation.

questions.question: What architectural safety feature does Deuteronomy 22:8 command when building a new house, and what is its purpose?
options: A battlement on the roof to prevent accidental falls
A moat surrounding the house to keep out animals
Thick walls for protection against enemies
A large doorway to allow easy access
questions.correctAnswer: A battlement on the roof to prevent accidental falls
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:8 instructs building a battlement on the roof to prevent accidental death by falling, showing concern for human safety in daily life.

questions.question: Which agricultural practice is forbidden in Deuteronomy 22:9-10, and what might this symbolize about Israel's identity?
options: Sowing a vineyard with mixed seeds and plowing with an ox and an ass together
Using irrigation systems from pagan nations
Planting vineyards near houses
Harvesting grapes before they are ripe
questions.correctAnswer: Sowing a vineyard with mixed seeds and plowing with an ox and an ass together
questions.explanation: The prohibition against mixing seeds and animals (Deuteronomy 22:9-10) symbolizes Israel's call to purity and separation from surrounding nations, reflecting holiness.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 22:11's prohibition against wearing garments of mixed wool and linen (sha'atnez) connect with ancient Near Eastern purity codes?
options: It reflects an Israelite emphasis on ritual purity and separation from pagan customs
It is meant to promote economic trade by limiting textile use
It forbids the use of wool and linen altogether
It encourages uniformity in clothing styles
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects an Israelite emphasis on ritual purity and separation from pagan customs
questions.explanation: The prohibition of mixing wool and linen in Deuteronomy 22:11 aligns with ancient purity laws aimed at maintaining Israel’s distinctiveness and holiness.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the fringes (tzitzit) commanded in Deuteronomy 22:12 on the four corners of garments?
options: To remind Israel of God's commandments and to live holy lives
To identify priests during worship
To decorate garments for festivals
To symbolize wealth and status
questions.correctAnswer: To remind Israel of God's commandments and to live holy lives
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:12 commands fringes to serve as a physical reminder of the law and Israel’s covenant obligation to holiness.

questions.question: In the legal case described in Deuteronomy 22:13-21, what is the significance of presenting the 'tokens of virginity' to the city elders?
options: It serves as proof to address accusations and uphold social justice
It is a religious ritual to sanctify marriage
It is a symbolic gift to the elders
It is a dowry paid to the bride’s family
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as proof to address accusations and uphold social justice
questions.explanation: The presenting of virginity tokens (Deuteronomy 22:13-21) functions as evidence in a legal dispute to protect a woman’s honor and ensure justice.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 22:22, what is the prescribed penalty for a man caught lying with a married woman, and what does this reveal about Israelite views on covenant fidelity?
options: Death for both the man and the woman, emphasizing the sanctity of marriage
A monetary fine paid to the husband
Exile from the community
A ritual cleansing ceremony
questions.correctAnswer: Death for both the man and the woman, emphasizing the sanctity of marriage
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:22 prescribes death to both parties involved in adultery, underscoring marriage’s sacred covenant and the seriousness of violating it.

questions.question: How does the punishment differ in Deuteronomy 22:23-27 between a betrothed virgin who is raped in the city and one who is raped in the field, and what does this reveal about the social context?
options: In the city both die, in the field only the rapist dies; showing concern for consent and protection
Both victims are punished in all cases
Only the women are punished regardless of location
There is no difference in punishment based on location
questions.correctAnswer: In the city both die, in the field only the rapist dies; showing concern for consent and protection
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:23-27 distinguishes cases based on location and consent, highlighting Israel’s attempt to protect the innocent and uphold justice.

questions.question: What legal requirement is established in Deuteronomy 22:28-29 when a man lies with a virgin not betrothed, and what does this imply about marriage customs?
options: The man must pay fifty shekels and marry her, showing the importance of social responsibility
The woman must leave her family
The man is exiled from the community
The woman is required to marry another man
questions.correctAnswer: The man must pay fifty shekels and marry her, showing the importance of social responsibility
questions.explanation: This law (Deuteronomy 22:28-29) ensures the man assumes responsibility for the woman, reflecting the value of protecting women’s social status.

questions.question: Deuteronomy 22:30 forbids a man to marry which relative, and what does this reveal about family boundaries in ancient Israel?
options: His father's wife, indicating respect for family and avoiding incestuous relationships
His sister, emphasizing clan purity
His cousin, forbidding close kin marriages
His mother, prohibiting mother-son unions
questions.correctAnswer: His father's wife, indicating respect for family and avoiding incestuous relationships
questions.explanation: The prohibition in Deuteronomy 22:30 reflects concerns for proper family order and avoiding incest, maintaining social and moral boundaries.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 22:1-4 uses a call to action that reflects the principle of "love your neighbor as yourself," a theme developed later in Leviticus and the New Testament.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The command to return lost property and help fallen animals in Deuteronomy 22:1-4 echoes the love and responsibility toward neighbors found in Leviticus 19:18 and echoed by Jesus in the New Testament.

questions.question: How does the legal material in Deuteronomy 22:13-21 foreshadow New Testament teachings on marriage and sexual morality?
options: By emphasizing the sanctity of marriage and consequences for false accusations
By allowing divorce for any reason
By permitting polygamy freely
By focusing on ritual sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: By emphasizing the sanctity of marriage and consequences for false accusations
questions.explanation: This passage anticipates New Testament emphasis on marital faithfulness and integrity, as seen in Jesus’ teachings in Matthew 5-19.

questions.question: What literary structure is evident in the first four verses of Deuteronomy 22, and what is its effect?
options: A chiasm emphasizing responsibility for a brother's lost property and aid in distress
A parable illustrating God's judgment
A poetic lament about lost animals
A historical narrative about Israel's journey
questions.correctAnswer: A chiasm emphasizing responsibility for a brother's lost property and aid in distress
questions.explanation: The repetition and parallelism in verses 1-4 form a chiasm that stresses communal responsibility to help and protect each other’s property and welfare.

theological.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Deuteronomy Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 22:1-4, what is the commanded attitude toward a brother's lost or fallen livestock?
options: You must ignore them to avoid involvement
You should help and restore them to your brother
You should sell them and keep the money
Only help if you know the owner personally
questions.correctAnswer: You should help and restore them to your brother
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:1-4 commands believers to restore lost animals to their brother and to help lift fallen animals, demonstrating God's care for neighbor and responsibility. This principle aligns with Proverbs 3:27, Luke 10:25-37 (Good Samaritan), Galatians 6:2, and James 2:15-16 about loving and helping others.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 22:5 teach about the distinction of gender roles in clothing?
options: A woman may wear men's clothing freely
Men and women are forbidden to wear garments of the opposite sex
Men must wear women's garments for special occasions
Clothing has no moral or spiritual significance
questions.correctAnswer: Men and women are forbidden to wear garments of the opposite sex
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:5 forbids cross-dressing as an abomination to God, reflecting the created order of male and female distinctions (Genesis 1:27). This teaching upholds God's design for gender roles and purity, supported by 1 Corinthians 11:14-15, Romans 1:26-27, and Matthew 19:4-6.

questions.question: In Deuteronomy 22:6-7, what is the reason given for letting the mother bird go when taking the young or eggs?
options: To obey local customs
To prolong your days and have well-being
To avoid making noise
To prevent harm to other animals
questions.correctAnswer: To prolong your days and have well-being
questions.explanation: The command to let the mother bird go (Deuteronomy 22:6-7) teaches care and mercy toward creation, promising longevity and blessing. This principle is echoed in Proverbs 12:10, Matthew 6:26, Psalm 36:6, and Luke 12:6-7, showing God's providential care over life.

questions.question: What structural safety measure does Deuteronomy 22:8 require when building a new house?
options: To build a battlement or railing on the roof
To build only one story
To avoid using wood in construction
To build a moat around the house
questions.correctAnswer: To build a battlement or railing on the roof
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:8 commands a battlement on roofs to prevent accidental deaths, showing God's concern for human life and safety. This principle resonates with Proverbs 22:3, Exodus 21:28-29, Psalm 127:1, and Matthew 7:24-27 about wise preparation and protection.

questions.question: Why does Deuteronomy 22:9 prohibit sowing a vineyard with diverse seeds?
options: Because it causes harvest to be defiled
Because diverse seeds are more expensive
Because it is too labor-intensive
Because God prefers only one kind of seed
questions.correctAnswer: Because it causes harvest to be defiled
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:9 forbids mixing seeds to prevent defilement of the crop, symbolizing God's call for purity and separation from corruption. This reflects Leviticus 19:19, 2 Corinthians 6:14, James 1:21-22, and Revelation 18:4 about holiness and separation from sin.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 22:10, what is forbidden in agricultural practice?
options: Plowing with an ox and an ass together
Planting wheat and barley in the same field
Harvesting on the Sabbath
Using iron tools for plowing
questions.correctAnswer: Plowing with an ox and an ass together
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:10 prohibits plowing with mismatched animals, emphasizing order and separation in God's law, symbolizing purity. This principle aligns with Leviticus 19:19, 2 Timothy 2:21, Romans 12:2, and Hebrews 12:14 on holiness and avoiding mixtures.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 22:11 teach about clothing materials?
options: Wool and linen should not be worn together
Only linen is acceptable for garments
All garments must be dyed
Clothing material is irrelevant
questions.correctAnswer: Wool and linen should not be worn together
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:11 forbids wearing garments made of mixed materials, teaching separation and purity in daily life. This principle is consistent with Leviticus 19:19, James 1:18, 2 Corinthians 6:17, and 1 Peter 1:15-16 about holiness.

questions.question: What command does Deuteronomy 22:12 give regarding the edges of garments?
options: To make fringes on the four corners
To dye them blue
To cut them short
To embroider them with gold
questions.correctAnswer: To make fringes on the four corners
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:12 instructs making fringes (tzitzit) on garment corners to remind God's people to obey His commandments. This is confirmed in Numbers 15:38-40, Matthew 23:5, Luke 11:42, and John 14:15 emphasizing obedience and remembrance of God's law.

questions.question: What was to be done if a man falsely accused his wife of not being a virgin at marriage, according to Deuteronomy 22:13-19?
options: He would be punished and must remain married to her
The woman would be stoned
They would be divorced immediately
The man would pay a fine and divorce is permitted
questions.correctAnswer: He would be punished and must remain married to her
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:13-19 prescribes punishment for a man falsely accusing his wife of premarital unchastity and mandates lifelong marriage, showing God's protection of a woman's honor and marriage sanctity. This accords with Exodus 20:14, Malachi 2:14-16, Hebrews 13:4, and Matthew 5:27-32 about faithfulness and truth.

questions.question: What penalty does Deuteronomy 22:20-21 prescribe if a woman is found not to be a virgin at marriage?
options: She shall be stoned to death
She shall be forgiven if she repents
She shall be divorced without penalty
She shall pay a fine to her father
questions.correctAnswer: She shall be stoned to death
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:20-21 commands stoning for a woman found not to be a virgin at marriage, reflecting the gravity of covenant faithfulness in Israel's theocratic context. This severe judgment aligns with Leviticus 20:10, Exodus 22:16-17, Hebrews 12:16, and emphasizes covenant purity and holiness before God.

questions.question: What is the consequence for a man and a married woman found lying together, as stated in Deuteronomy 22:22?
options: Both shall be put to death
Only the man shall be punished
Only the woman shall be punished
They shall be divorced but not executed
questions.correctAnswer: Both shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:22 prescribes death for both parties committing adultery, underlining the seriousness of violating marriage vows and God's covenant. This is consistent with Leviticus 20:10, Proverbs 6:32-33, Hebrews 13:4, and John 8:3-11 emphasizing holiness and justice.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 22:23-24, what is the punishment for a man who lies with a betrothed virgin in the city?
options: Both shall be stoned to death
Only the man shall be stoned
Only the woman shall be stoned
They shall be publicly reprimanded
questions.correctAnswer: Both shall be stoned to death
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:23-24 commands stoning both the man and the betrothed virgin if caught in the city, stressing communal responsibility and the protection of betrothal sanctity. This is in accord with Leviticus 20:13, Exodus 22:15-16, Romans 13:4, and Hebrews 10:26-31 about justice and holiness.

questions.question: What exception is made in Deuteronomy 22:25-27 regarding a betrothed virgin found in the field and forced by a man?
options: Only the man is put to death; the woman is innocent
Both must be punished equally
Only the woman is punished
They must both marry immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Only the man is put to death; the woman is innocent
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:25-27 exempts the woman from punishment when forced, recognizing her innocence and the violent nature of the crime. This aligns with Exodus 22:16-17, Psalm 34:18, Isaiah 1:17, and 2 Corinthians 1:3-4 about justice and compassion for the oppressed.

questions.question: What restitution must a man make if he lies with a virgin who is not betrothed, according to Deuteronomy 22:28-29?
options: Pay fifty shekels to her father and marry her
Pay a fine but no marriage is required
Marry her but pay no fine
No penalty if the woman agrees
questions.correctAnswer: Pay fifty shekels to her father and marry her
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:28-29 requires the man to pay a bride-price and marry the virgin to protect her dignity and provide security. This reflects Exodus 22:16-17, Ruth 4:9-10, Matthew 1:18-25, and 1 Corinthians 7:39 emphasizing protection and covenant responsibility.

questions.question: What prohibition about family relationships is found in Deuteronomy 22:30?
options: A man shall not marry his father's wife
A man may marry his father's wife after divorce
A man shall not marry his sister
A man may marry his mother's sister
questions.correctAnswer: A man shall not marry his father's wife
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22:30 forbids a man from marrying his father's wife, protecting family purity and God's order of relationships. This is consistent with Leviticus 18:8, 1 Corinthians 5:1, Romans 1:26-27, and Hebrews 13:4 emphasizing holiness in family and marriage.

questions.question: What theological principle about justice and community purity is emphasized throughout Deuteronomy 22?
options: God calls His people to uphold holiness by removing evil
Punishments are optional and symbolic only
Community purity is less important than individual freedom
Justice is only for the wealthy and powerful
questions.correctAnswer: God calls His people to uphold holiness by removing evil
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 22 continually commands removal of evil and upholding holiness to maintain covenant community purity (e.g., stoning for adultery). This is affirmed in Leviticus 20:7-8, Psalm 34:14, 1 Peter 1:15-16, and Revelation 21:27 about God's holiness and justice.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 22's teaching on caring for lost animals and vulnerable birds reflect God's character?
options: It shows God's justice, mercy, and providential care
It emphasizes strict legalism without compassion
It prioritizes human gain over animal welfare
It allows neglect of others if inconvenient
questions.correctAnswer: It shows God's justice, mercy, and providential care
questions.explanation: Commands to restore lost animals and protect mother birds (Deuteronomy 22:1-7) reveal God's justice and mercy, caring for neighbor and creation. This echoes Psalm 145:9, Matthew 10:29-31, Proverbs 12:10, and Luke 12:6-7 demonstrating God's providence and compassion.
